definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]

sentences.english: Only one state -- Michigan -- saw statistically significant increases in poverty two years in a row.
sentences.chinese: 只有密歇根州連續兩年貧困率攀升具有統計學意義。

sentences.english: Motor traders are looking forward to a further increase in vehicle sales.
sentences.chinese: 廋汽車經銷商預期汽車銷量會進一步攀升。

sentences.english: Another spike in unemployment could well set it loose.
sentences.chinese: 失業率的再次攀升可能會讓保護主義成爲脫繮之馬。

sentences.english: The temperature has been going up in Karachi, Pakistan recently.
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦喀拉蚩的氣溫最近不斷攀升。

sentences.english: Or if Scarlett climbs, then I can climb it.
sentences.chinese: 或者，如果斯佳麗的攀升，那麼我可以爬上去。

sentences.english: The housing prices of Beijing continue growing over seven months in a double-digit.
sentences.chinese: 另外一方面，中國房地產價格也不斷攀升。

sentences.english: Hotel occupancy rose once again in the first nine months of 2003.
sentences.chinese: 酒店入住率於二零零三年首九個月再度攀升。

sentences.english: In the process, China has become the world s third largest trader.
sentences.chinese: 此間中國攀升爲世界第三大貿易國。

sentences.english: Gold holdings via exchange-listed vehicles surged to records this year.
sentences.chinese: 通過上市交易基金持有黃金本年攀升至記錄水平。

sentences.english: Twilight descends in new Hampshire as an old man climbs onto his soapbox.
sentences.chinese: 暮色降臨在新罕布什爾州的一個老頭到他肥皂盒攀升。

sentences.english: Food pantries and soup kitchens all over the country have seen demand for their services soar.
sentences.chinese: 全國各地食物站和施捨處的服務需求量在不斷攀升。

sentences.english: Transforming agricultural land into energy resources drives the price of food into the stratosphere.
sentences.chinese: 將農用耕地轉變爲能源來源促使糧食價格大幅攀升。

sentences.english: Undoubtedly, moderate inflation can creep up to become high inflation.
sentences.chinese: 誠然，溫和通脹會節節攀升，直至變爲高通脹。

sentences.english: The steel wire establishment is much long, the hanging basket can climb high.
sentences.chinese: 鋼絲繩設置多長，吊籃就能攀升多高。

sentences.english: He says one cause of rising prices is an "excessive" money supply.
sentences.chinese: 謝伏瞻說，物價攀升的一個原因是貨幣供應過量。

sentences.english: Profits have spiked at gold-mining companies. (See pictures of modern-day gold prospectors.)
sentences.chinese: 金礦公司的利潤就此攀升。

definition: to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
(of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket
to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to press on towards/to close in on/to approach/to draw near
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
